Wheat production will drop by at least 5 MMT with a temperature rise of one degree Celsius. If temperatures rise further beyond 2 °C, the losses will increase rapidly. Year is the year the document was published, and the results are projections.

The text describes the true cost of food, including environmental, health, and economic externalities, vastly exceeding current global food consumption costs. The value includes external costs of 4–11 trillion USD for environmental factors and 3–39 trillion USD for health issues. Given that these figures are presented as a range and not related explicitly to climate change scenarios but general environmental and health factors, they may not precisely align as climate change-specific outcomes.
